title: UN Women designates Hania Aamir as National Goodwill Ambassador for Pakistan
content:
ISLAMABAD, Oct 16 (APP):The United Nations Entity for Gender Equality and the Empowerment of Women (UN Women) has officially appointed actor and youth icon Hania Aamir as its National Goodwill Ambassador for Pakistan.
In her new role, Hania Aamir will serve as a voice for women and girls across the country, leveraging her wide public influence to promote gender equality, women’s empowerment, and social inclusion. She will collaborate with UN Women to raise awareness, inspire collective action, and amplify the voices of those often unheard, particularly in areas related to women’s economic empowerment, leadership, digital inclusion, and the prevention of gender-based violence.
Hania Aamir succeeds Muniba Mazari, who held the honorary position until August 2025 and continues to be an influential global advocate for women’s rights, inclusion, and social justice.
Expressing her gratitude and sense of duty, Hania Aamir remarked:
“I am deeply honored to be designated as UN Women’s National Goodwill Ambassador for Pakistan. This is more than just a title — it is a commitment to speak up for women and girls whose voices deserve to be heard. I hope to contribute meaningfully by championing equality, promoting empowerment, and helping create opportunities where every woman and girl can shape her own future with confidence and dignity.”
Welcoming her appointment, Jamshed M. Kazi, Country Representative of UN Women Pakistan, highlighted the significance of this milestone:
“Hania’s appointment comes at a pivotal time as we commemorate 30 years of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action — a landmark global agenda for women’s rights and gender equality. Her passion, creativity, and strong connection with Pakistan’s youth make her an ideal advocate to carry forward UN Women’s mission. We look forward to working closely with her to turn awareness into concrete action and transformative change for women and girls across Pakistan.”
As National Goodwill Ambassador, Hania Aamir will take part in UN Women-led campaigns and initiatives aimed at strengthening women’s participation in the economy, leadership roles, and digital innovation. She will also support advocacy efforts addressing climate resilience, education access, and protection from gender-based violence, reinforcing her commitment to a more equitable and inclusive society.
UN Women is the United Nations organization dedicated to gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls. The organization works in partnership with governments, civil society, and communities to advance women’s rights, shape inclusive policies, and create systemic change for a fairer, more equal world.
